website_summaries.verdict: A good all-around router bit set for occasional do-it-yourselfers, hobbyists and woodworkers. Light projects are no problem for this set, though users should look for tougher, larger drill bits for bigger jobs.
pros: A lot of satisfied buyers of this set, with some reporting they would buy it again
Most liked the packaging, which is attractive and holds the parts well
Carbide-tipped bits stay sharp and fit small routers well
cons: Customer service was somewhat problematic when trying to get replacement parts, although Amazon return service is satisfactory
Bits get dull quickly and can snap while doing heavier work

customer_reviews.title: The best way to describe my use of them is as ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had these bits for about a year now and I would buy them again. The best way to describe my use of them is as a novice woodworker, so I haven't really put them through any grueling tests but they've definitely proved themselves as a great value. They're not as solid as my rockler tongue and groove cutter bit set but they also cost less and you get way more of them. Overall, I feel like I definitely got more than I paid for... for once in my life. I recommend these to anyone even if you only use half of the bits.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Easlick

customer_reviews.title: Good value on a set of generic / chinese bits.
customer_reviews.text: First time router owner / user here. I bought these bits to go with the Makita RT0701CX3 1-1/4 HP Compact Router Kit. I've put a total of about 30 minutes of actual cutting time spread over 3 or 4 of them. So far they are all working fine in softwood and hardwood as well. For a newbie router owner it's hard to pass up a set of 15 bits for the price of 1 or 2 Bosch or Freud-brand bits. 4 stars for value. The wood box they come in is handy, not excellent quality but good enough. I'll update this review in 6 months or a year after extended usage.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Valnonnia

customer_reviews.title: At home use, good bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price and a good variety. These are acceptable for home projects or light work, your not making oak cabinets with this set (ok, maybe one set). I have used most of these, some are just odd shapes that I don't use - yet anyway. They seem to cut pine and maple and didn't dull down very fast. The bearings are a little cheap, but replace them for $2 each and the cutter is ready to go again (this time with better bearings) and your still well below the $20 each for the name branded cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Sally A. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Good starter set and not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: These bits are a great starter set if you just need options for occassional use. If i could do it again, I would buy the bit I need for each project and get a really good brand (Freud, Whiteside). I've used two of these and they cut fine but I am concerned about durability. For the price, i guess you can't really go wrong or lose a lot. The positive reviews helped me purchase. If you're starting out and just want some bits to explore with, then this is your set. As 4 starts indicate "I like it" but I don't "love it" but I don't expect much more for the money. Happy woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: ... these to go with my router and am very satisfied. They're not Diablo's but the whole set costs ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go with my router and am very satisfied. They're not Diablo's but the whole set costs about as much as two or three of those and work just as well for hobby grade projects. If I ever use one bit enough that it wears out, I can just replace that one with a pro grade cutter. Great value, very happy with purchase. If I ever get a router that takes 1/2" shanks, I'll be ordering this same set in that size.
customer_reviews.author: Spevak family

customer_reviews.title: Error in production description
customer_reviews.text: I also got stung by the incorrect product description. This is my first router bit set. I specifically needed the 3/16 straight bit. The product description says it includes these 4 straight bits, 3/16", 1/4", 1/2", 3/4" ... but it actually includes these, 1/4", 3/8", 1/2", 3/4".
customer_reviews.author: Perry Smothers

customer_reviews.title: Respect them and they'll respect your projects
customer_reviews.text: I've used only 5 of the bits but those 5 I've used a TON. Work great every time. After each use I put them back in the case so they'll remain working as expected. I never let them touch one another and never lay them down on my bench.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P

customer_reviews.title: Just get these
customer_reviews.text: This set is an awesome value for the money, and the wood box helps you stay organized. I bought these when I was starting out woodworking and almost every piece has come in handy at some point or another. They came with a light coating of some kind of oil or lubricant, which I removed with alcohol. Use these exclusively in my trim router now.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good set for a first time router owner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first router and wanted to have a set of shanks in order to have several options available for projects. This kit fit the bill. I cannot speak to the long term use of these shanks, however for a nice set to have all options around the house and for a new router, this was an excellent value. I will update if any of the bits fail prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: SK Wire

customer_reviews.title: Router Bit Set
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the MLCS 6077 Woodworking Router Bit Set together with the Bosch PR EVSK Colt Palm Grip Router. I received both promptly, though separately, within a few days of ordering. The set had exactly the types of bits I would need as a beginner for the type of work I would do at home. I have used several of them already, and everything worked just perfectly. I also like the handsome box that holds the bits for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Werner Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Top of the charts.
customer_reviews.text: I had just begun a project; routing dado's in a 2x12 piece of pine and these bits arrived two days early. They were wonderfully packaged and the box and shelves the bits come in are top notch. Very nice product. I used the 1/2 inch straight bit to cut the dado's and cut them 1/4 inch deep. The bit had absolutely no problem; no burning, binding or breaking. Cut as nice as my American Vermont bit. Can't wait to test the other bits on scrape pine pieces I have. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Supreme Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Best deal on router bits
customer_reviews.text: Of all the grades of router bits, while these are not the very best, they are still very sharp, very well made, hold up and for my use with my small router, more than good enough. The finish they provide is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Gary O. Ferrini

customer_reviews.title: Obviously it is nice to have a little storage box come with them
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for only occasional router usage. I can't comment on how long-lasting the bits will be. Obviously it is nice to have a little storage box come with them. I do wish the identification sheet that comes with the set was a little more detailed or clearer about the pattern that each bit produces. Also I still have no idea what the usage is for the little Allen wrench and the tiny insert piece shown in the illustration.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rotondo

customer_reviews.title: but these bits seem to be good enough quality for occasional applications
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to testing these bits. I would have preferred the 1/2 inch shanks, but my router wouldn't accommodate them. I don't do a lot of router work, but these bits seem to be good enough quality for occasional applications. The box is well stocked with many cutting shapes and the bits fit snugly inside their slots. Very happy with the set so far. I will update if things change with further use. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas DriscollTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for experimenting
customer_reviews.text: Nice cheap set for experimenting, but the shanks are a little fat for my Bosch Colt. They're pretty hard to shove in there, but once in, they get the job done quite well. If you know specifically what bit you need, you're better off buying it solo. But if you're unsure, or just want to experiment, this has a well curated selection of decent-quality bits to play with. I've done some edging, relief carving, and planing (with the 1/2" straight bit), and had no trouble with either accuracy or smoothness. So this set is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Blinkozo

customer_reviews.title: They come nicely packaged in a wooden box with individual slots for ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had these bits for a short time and have used only 2 of the bits. Using a router is a new experience for me. The bits have worked well. They come nicely packaged in a wooden box with individual slots for each bit and each is labeled regarding size, name and what it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Lilee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price but I found there were ...
customer_reviews.text: most basic bits. Good quality for the price but I found there were only a couple in this set to meet job specific needs for a couple projects I am working on. So you may need to consider the cost of 2 or 3 specific bits if you have some projects you are planning on doing...it may be better to buy the bits you need rather than buy this set and wind up with a bunch of bits you don't currently need.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Whitis

customer_reviews.title: Used 2x and failure
customer_reviews.text: The bearing blew up on my flush trim bit and messed up my template and my final piece. Was trimming plywood. I will replace with something that is higher quality. I guess it is a good set to get started with, but I wouldn't trust it for anything that I want to show or am not willing to risk starting over on.
customer_reviews.author: Anne B.

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: These bits are my first pair I have ever purchased and they seem to be pretty good quality. I have noticed that some of the bits were chipped on the paint part of the bit after I used it a couple times. However it did not hinder its operation efficiency. These are some of the best bits I have seen for this price range and would say if you need some router bits, you should give these a try. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TychiBalls

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: i am not a cabinet maker, just a hobbiest. this set is just what the doctor ordered for those occasional routing jobs. i use the set with the dewalt 611 compact router and they performed as expected. the box they come in is real nice. i am a fan of boxes/cases. if you want bits for a production shop look elsewhere, but expect to pay a lot more. remember you get what you pay for. if you need bits for hobby jobs. these will fill the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Paoletta

customer_reviews.title: Nice bits
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used the dovetail bit. It cut through oak like butter. So far I'm happy with them. The wooden storage box keeps the bits tight and protected. Nice bits...
customer_reviews.author: JSamples

customer_reviews.title: Lots 'o bits!
customer_reviews.text: They are my first bits for my first router...so I'm my review isn't exactly based on decades of woodworking experience. The two I've used worked well. One actually broke but that was my own fault (wood moved and it didn't survive the twist). Many of them I'm not sure where I'd use but hopefully that will become apparent as I undertake more projects.
customer_reviews.author: Freckles

customer_reviews.title: Good set
customer_reviews.text: Good set. Haven't used all the bits yet but the ones I've used have remained sharp. Looks to be of good quality. Love the added wooden box for carrying/sorting. Be careful not to cut your hand removing the bits --- the fit is very snug on a few pieces.
customer_reviews.author: mayozack

customer_reviews.title: Very nice basic selection of router bits
customer_reviews.text: I have always been pleased with MLCS products and these bits will not disappoint. They come in a handy little box that allows you to lift out each row of bits. The little allen wrench to adjust and change bearings is a nice touch. I added a couple double flute spiral bits to my order and now I am good to go. No hesitation in reccomending these bits.
customer_reviews.author: Warren W. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Some nice bits
customer_reviews.text: There work VERY well! Although you will soon want more than just the Roman bit as that is really the only interesting decorative bit. All other bits are the essentials and work lovely at least on fairly soft wood. I have not tried it on hard wood yet
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the DIY'er
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set after getting the half inch shank version (MLCS 8377). They worked so well that there wasn't much of a decision to purchase this set to fill out my quarter inch shank collection. So far I've used only a couple of these bits, but they cut smoothly and the bearings in the guided bits run without binding or heating. For occasional usage by a DIY'er or hobbyist, this is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: MarkC

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great value
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great value. I also have the 1/2 set and have used that with no problem for years. Only used one of the straight bits in my palm router to widen a dado, and it made short work of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom and Physician

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Pros - A lot of Bits for the money. Decent quality. Very nice case. Cons - Considering the price, none. Overall - A very nice set of medium grade router bits, used the 1/2 and 3/4 inch channel cut bits in treated wet lumber and they sliced through the wood without a problem, very good value!
customer_reviews.author: Dirk

customer_reviews.title: Good yet affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and great product especially for new woodworker. Have been using for more than a year and it's still working well and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: lee sin yoong

customer_reviews.title: Quality is comparable to its price so not much to ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality is comparable to its price so not much to complain about. The wider bits will not fit through the baseplate of a Makita palm router, so be aware that you must make your own or modify.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These worked great, and compared to the prices at name brand stores...You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: henry joe keese

customer_reviews.title: Great First Set for Hobbyists
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't use these to make a living as a woodworker, but for my occasional hobby/DIY weekend projects this is a great introductory kit! Surprisingly nicely packaged.
customer_reviews.author: HeLa

customer_reviews.title: but so far they seem superior to those you can get at local big box ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use them all yet, but so far they seem superior to those you can get at local big box stores while being inexpensive in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice router bit set
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool set. Got it along with a Bosch palm router and I am still using it. The tools are very sharp and a good quality as far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnie

customer_reviews.title: At this price you can't expect more.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used these yet. I don't know how they will perform. From their appearance they don't seem that well made. But then the good part is they didn't cost much either.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: but this bits are much better than the other set I bought
customer_reviews.text: I never used a router before, but this bits are much better than the other set I bought. Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Henry S.

customer_reviews.title: Got this for starting out
customer_reviews.text: The bits seem well-made and I like all the variety. I am a beginner, so I don't know what to expect, but some of the cutting I did finished a little rough or flung some chips off at the edge of the wood. I don't know if this is a result of the bits or me having the wrong speed dialed in or having too high of a feed rate.
customer_reviews.author: chrisham

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for my Bosch Colt router! Sharp as a tack, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Richard the swimmer

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Very good value for price. Intended for sporadic homeowner use, and well suited for that purpose. I use set with a Bosch palm router for freehand work.
customer_reviews.author: KCPortland

customer_reviews.title: These are bits are recommended on the woodworking sites I frequent
customer_reviews.text: I am new to routing so I did not want to spend too much on bits while still learning. These have worked very well for me and seem to stay sharp. These are bits are recommended on the woodworking sites I frequent.
customer_reviews.author: Terrapin88

customer_reviews.title: Great router bits for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic set of router bits - very high quality for the price. I like that they came in a nice carrying case. So far no complaints and I've used them several times.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: While this is an extensive collection of bits and a great starter kit from that perspective, I've had two bits snap from limited usage so far. I won't be buying from these folks again.
customer_reviews.author: Novum

customer_reviews.title: Low cost, carbide-tipped router bits
customer_reviews.text: Nice wood case, and a wide assortment of carbide router bits, including extra ball bearing guide and wrench. I haven't used any of these yet on my new Bosch palm router, but they appear as good as my 1/2 -inch carbide router bits I've purchase in past years.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Sly

customer_reviews.title: router bit
customer_reviews.text: bought this set on Amazon for home use as i am DIYER on weekend and so far they are working well. i would recommend this product to the weekend warriors
customer_reviews.author: danman bz

customer_reviews.title: this item is great nice box that it comes in
customer_reviews.text: this item is great nice box that it comes in, the bits are all very well made and have not used all of them yet, but the ones I have make a very good cut.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great set of router bits, for a super price!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome buy for such a high quality set of bits! I will be buying more and more of these, as soon as I can save up enough money! The wooden box is a very nice touch too!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Crenshaw

customer_reviews.title: Sharp And Ready To Rock!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of woodwork, trim, and fabrication in the shop with these bits. At a fraction of the cost of other carbide bits, these are one of my shop "workhorses". The bits are sharp, the guide bearings are smoothe, and the set provides functionality of the most common bits that I use. So smoothe and sharp that I use them in my laminate trimmer rather than my big router. I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Boyd Muzzana

customer_reviews.title: Spins and Cuts
customer_reviews.text: Good starter set, not emotionally attached to them if I hit a nail.
customer_reviews.author: Smudgiewedge

customer_reviews.title: Fit the Bill....
customer_reviews.text: As a home project kind of guy I don't always need the top shelf higher priced tool. These bits "fit the bill" and were affordable. Thus far I have used them and are pleased. Thanks Amazon for having them available.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Best router bits set ever.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best bits for doing cabinet work specially for making cabinet drawers and lining the smooth cuts on cabinet doors. They cut easily and best of all they come in a great looking wooden box.
customer_reviews.author: Flex

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend to a
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered. I am a novice to using a router and this set really helped me out in learning about the basics of router bits and their uses. I would definitely recommend to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Paddle

customer_reviews.title: To this point, I haven't used all the bits ...
customer_reviews.text: To this point, I haven't used all the bits, but the ones I have used cut smoothly and have worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Don Tibbetts

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality bit set
customer_reviews.text: For the occasional woodworker, MLCS bits are an excellent buy. I bought this set to go along with a Bosch trim router. Great combo.
customer_reviews.author: Double Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Bits
customer_reviews.text: Great starter set. They work really well on softwoods, not sure how they would hold up for hardwoods, but for the price these cant be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan D Wood

customer_reviews.title: A+++++ seller and product
customer_reviews.text: A++++ great product and great seller to do business with....definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good buy for someone as a first foray into working with routers, woodworking in general. The packaging is quite attractive and made for an excellent Christmas present. I would not recommend for a professional, but for the hobbyist they work quite well!
customer_reviews.author: S. Fear

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the quality of these bits. I have only used a few of the, but so far so good. Cut clean and seem to be very well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Only a few bits that are useful
customer_reviews.text: only a few bits that are useful, good for the price and little work at home, not recommend for industrial
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: you cannot go wrong with these!!!
customer_reviews.text: great starter kit for the average DIY!!!..great storage box that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: ====the garage====

customer_reviews.title: Great set and sturdy case
customer_reviews.text: I used the bits in my compact router and it did the job. Great set at a reasonable price. The box keeps the bits in place and prevents damaging them on each other.
customer_reviews.author: kauai yorozuya

customer_reviews.title: but what I have used has delivered great results!
customer_reviews.text: Bits worked as expected. Have not used all, but what I have used has delivered great results!
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: My husband says he LOVES this for the price!
customer_reviews.text: "For the price, it can't be beat!" verbatim from my husband, the woodworker (Adirondack chairs; interior molding) I reap the rewards of the work he does!
customer_reviews.author: orchid lady

customer_reviews.title: This is one heck of a deal.
customer_reviews.text: With a name brand, ONE of these router bits would cost as much as this whole kit... This was the first time I had ever used a router, these bits ate through 1 inch red oak like it was nothing and show no wear, these are great. Also, make sure you tighten your router chuck with a pair of plyers... not with your hands like you would a dremel... totally different tools. If you hand tighten a router bit into your router it will come loose and shoot across your garage and put a hole in the dry wall... Yes, I was the genius that did that and I speak from experience. Oops.
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what my son was looking for, for his new router.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Pence

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good value bits for the DIY'er. I have used a few of them & they hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: G Mac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: These are a solid value if you need to do minor routering here and there on simple / not high end projects. Cannot complain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Downing Heese

customer_reviews.title: Router Bit Set,
customer_reviews.text: Nice and handy for the low price. But does not have all the bits needed...No problem
customer_reviews.author: Harold R. Harms

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I've used only 3 out of the set but used them hard. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: JeffersonOh

customer_reviews.title: good deal
customer_reviews.text: Nice set, I've only used a few of them so far but they work great.
customer_reviews.author: jsf

customer_reviews.title: Good Set.
customer_reviews.text: Good variety bit set. Gives you most every general bit you will need. Quality is pretty good for this set.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome products
customer_reviews.text: love this kit. the box is a perfect storage for the bits. very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse C

customer_reviews.title: Good starter kit
customer_reviews.text: I've had a router forever but never used it. So, I purchased this kit to start me off since individual bits are crazy expensive. Pro: -Appears to be a good quality set -Wood case -Variety of bits to get you started (decide what type of bits you will use, etc) -I've used about half of the bits and they have all produced nice clean cuts Cons: -Compared to the other kits with this quanity, I wish it had another rounder bit.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Work great, no problems. I really like the box they come in.
customer_reviews.author: Husker021

customer_reviews.title: Good for My Light Duty Needs
customer_reviews.text: I do light duty routing and this set suits me just fine. A nice basic selection.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: The bits are great, the kit has all the common bits
customer_reviews.text: The bits are great, the kit has all the common bits, the delivery is quick and I am always a sucker for a nice storage case. I
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 1/2 set years ago, liked them so much I ordered the 1/4 set for palm router recently. Excellent bits for the price. Better than box store sets. Good diy/do all set.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: very nice tool, and box is nice to. hope everything works good when going back home to work on wood
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Monreno

customer_reviews.title: gift
customer_reviews.text: router bits are terribly expensive so it was nice to find a variety at a good price. My husband uses them for his woodworking
customer_reviews.author: Della Cramton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good price for the set. I am pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: B-Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Great quality router bits for the money - great value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these router bits for quite some time now. They perform flawlessly. I would order MLCS bits again. They seem to wear quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

customer_reviews.title: nice storage box
customer_reviews.text: worked exactly as needed. nice storage box. and a heck-of-a better price than buying one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Buckley

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: Router bit set is worth the money for the number of bits receive. As these wear out iI plan to replace the more commonly used ones with higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: R. Corless

customer_reviews.title: A joy to own
customer_reviews.text: A joy to own. You live only once; might as well go first class :) I am still discovering the potential that this kit offers together with its educational, instruction manual. Yes, if not pushed too hard, this machine will accomplish just about anything you'd throw at its bigger brothers. That is, one might have to make a few extra passes with smaller bites - for projects, that otherwise, would demand V8 horsepower.
customer_reviews.author: Homer

customer_reviews.title: variety of bits
customer_reviews.text: I have only used one bit so far but I hope to be using more in the future. The one I used worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Amoroso

customer_reviews.title: great router selection
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time, used them right away and easy to adjust and fit into the palm router. highly recommended to all wood workers.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN R. (Carmel)

customer_reviews.title: Good bits, would be nice to have a profile image included
customer_reviews.text: These are good router bits. Not fantastically amazing, but very good. The only thing I wish they included was an image of the profile for each one - even better if there were dimensions associated with each bit's image. They include an extra bearing which lets you use the edging bits to make some other profiles as well. I haven't tried every single bit in the set but the ones I used worked well on some oak stock I had. I think for most weekend woodworkers these will be a valuable addition to your collection of tools.
customer_reviews.author: EngineerChic

customer_reviews.title: The bits themselves seem fine.
customer_reviews.text: They were suggested for the Makita compact router, but I can't seem to get half the bits on with the compact base, only with the plunge base. The bits themselves seem fine.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: fine quality, good for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: fine quality, good for beginners. if you have not bought router, I will advise to go for 1/2" router. other wise if you change the router to 1/2" in future all you investment on bits will go in vain. if you bought 1/4" router then this set has a very nice collection of bits with fine quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mamoon

customer_reviews.title: Nice bits for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to big routers. I usually use a laminate cutter for small jobs, so I do not have many bits. I bought this set after getting a full size router as a present and they work wonderfully. I'm very pleased with the quality of these reasonably priced bits. I was afraid I would have to spend big bucks to get anything I would be happy with. Not the case this time.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia K. Kearney

customer_reviews.title: Great set of starter bits
customer_reviews.text: Great set of starter bits. I have put some through the paces and have not used most. For the price of a single nice bit it is great to have options. As they wear out I will replace my most used bits with quality ones. I find the case to be convenient and sturdy enough and it performs its main task of protecting the cutting edges while not in use.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: ... a inexpensive set of bits to start would be good, the big thing is not knowing alot i ...
customer_reviews.text: i am not using a router so i thought a inexpensive set of bits to start would be good, the big thing is not knowing alot i assumed they they would have pictures of what shape the bit cuts in the wood, and would have the name labeled, most bit sets i have seen do this on the case but not this one. the bit i have figured out what they are used for seem to work fine
customer_reviews.author: Cliff & Rae

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of bits
customer_reviews.text: I've only used one of the bits so far but it cuts thru pine and oak with no problems. For the money it is a nice set. The catalog from MLCS that was included has me tempted to purchase several other things from them when I expand my woodworking abilities down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter kit for a 1/4 shank collet. I also have their larger set of 1/2 shank bits as well which I am very happy with. Would recommend. Bits are solid and sharp. Very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Yen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Machine
customer_reviews.text: I've built a cnc router table for hobby projects. I power the cutting device with a Porter Cable router. These bits are for use with that router (@27,000rpm) and they work perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. Colley

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I,m impressed with the quality of the product and the case I did not use all the tips yet but looks very good.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Carlos S A lmeida

customer_reviews.title: Great price, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are a highly payed professional woodworker that can afford paying $25 per bit, this is a great set. I have used them for several projects with great results. Unless you can write them off, don't waste your money on the more expensive sets.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but not low cost junk
customer_reviews.text: I own the 1/4" and 1/2" shank versions of this set. The bits are sharp, packed with some grease, and well presented in a sturdy box. Very useful for most day to day routing needs. If you need something specific, the brand (MLCS) has hundreds of other bits to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Carroll

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I am a casual woodworker and have used this set quite a 'bit'. Good assortment and a great price. Quality seems high.
customer_reviews.author: Leo D. Gunter

customer_reviews.title: It will get the job done
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. They dull quicker than I would like. If you are doing very casual work for a craft or something similar these will work just fine. If you are planning on building your own cabinets, spend the money on a better set.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Good christmas present.
customer_reviews.text: This also was a christmas present that my husband seemed excited to get, haven't seen him use them yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Shanahan

product_meta.title: MLCS 6077 Woodworking 1/4-Inch shank Carbide-tipped Router Bit Set, 15-Piece
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
High quality carbide-tipped set includes 4-straight bits (3/16-Inch, 1/4-Inch, 1/2-Inch, 3/4-Inch), 1-round over bit (3/8-Inch), 1-cove bit (1/2-Inch), 1-Roman ogee bit (5/32-Inch), one 45-Degree chamfer bit, 1-flush trim bit (1/2-Inch), 1-rabbeting bit (3/8-Inch), 1-dovetail bit (1/2-Inch by 14-Degree), one V-groove bit (3/8-Inch), 1-hinge mortising bit (1/2-Inch), 1-panel Pilot bit (1/4-Inch), 1-round nose bit (1/4-Inch), 1-Allen wrench and 1-bearing to convert round over bit into beading bit. Sturdy wood storage box also included.
feature_bullets: Perfect, economical, all-purpose starter set for your woodworking hobby
